translation.en: I'm really worried about him.
Me too. I've never seen him this upset.
translation.fr: Oui, je ne l'ai jamais vu si déprimé.

translation.en: - I know. - He's taking it hard.
You know what he said to me? He said he'll never write another story ever again.
translation.fr: Tu sais ce qu'il m'a dit ? Qu'il n'écrirait plus jamais.

translation.en: - He said that? - Yeah.
This is lame! Stupid!
I'm gonna burn all this stupid stuff!
I'm so afraid that tonight is gonna, like, stifle him
translation.fr: GÉNÉRATION PERDUE J'ai peur que tout ça le brise,

translation.en: or be this wound that haunts him.
Poor little guy.
He's a creative kid, but maybe we let his obsession with horror get out of hand.
translation.fr: Il est créatif, mais son obsession pour l'horreur a dérapé.

translation.en: I guess I can see how they could consider it a little weird.
translation.fr: Les gens trouvent ça un peu bizarre.

translation.en: Maybe it would be easier if he was just more, I don't know, normal.
translation.fr: Ce serait plus facile s'il était plus normal.

translation.en: I think I heard something.
translation.fr: Il y a eu un bruit.

translation.en: Alex?
I didn't hear anything.
It was all gonna be so perfect, Lucy…
…just like one big, happy family.
Your boys
and my boys.
Great. The bloodsucking Brady Bunch.
translation.fr: Super. Une vraie tribu de vampires.

translation.en: Lost Boys? I still want you, Lucy.
translation.fr: - Génération perdue ? - Je te veux toujours.

translation.en: I haven't changed my mind about that.
I didn't invite you this time, Max.  Michael.
translation.fr: - Je ne t'ai pas invité, Max. - Michael.

translation.en: Michael!
- Don't you touch my mother! - Sam, don't! No, Sam!
Where am I?
- - Hello?
Hello?
Anyone?
I'm trapped!
Mom!
Dad!
- Hello? Help! -
What is your name?
A… Alex.
Let's get this over with. I'm a busy witch. Are you useful in any way?
translation.fr: Bon, je suis une sorcière occupée. Es-tu utile ?

translation.en: Uh, I…
Do you see them?
The apartment lured them in.
That's what the apartment does.
Those children,
they were not useful to me.
Do you understand?
So let's try this again.
Is there anything special about you at all?
Any reason I should let you live?
- And get up. -
Come closer.
Goodbye, Alex.
I do write scary stories.
Did you say scary stories?
What's… what's that?
No more questions.
My Nightbooks. It's where I wrote my stories.
translation.fr: Mes journaux de la nuit, mes histoires.

translation.en: What are you doing with these so late at night? I was…
translation.fr: - Que fais-tu avec ça si tard ? - J'allais…

translation.en: I was gonna burn them in the boiler room downstairs.
Burn them? So they're not any good.
- No. - Goodbye, Alex.
They're good. They're very, really, really good.
Nightbooks, huh?
The title better not be the scariest thing about them. I'm going to need a story every night.
translation.fr: Si c'est plus effrayant que le titre, il m'en faudra une chaque soir.

translation.en: The story better be good, and it better be scary,
translation.fr: L'histoire devra être bonne et effrayante,

translation.en: or it's the last thing you'll ever do.
translation.fr: ou c'en est fini de toi.

translation.en: - - It's a little kitty.
Mischievous little thing.
How'd you get in here? - -
What is this place?
Where's the TV?
And where'd the front door go?
Oh my God.
You scared me.
What?
- You're a kid. - And you're a genius.
translation.fr: - T'es une enfant. - Toi, un génie.

translation.en: I'm Alex. Who are you?
You're gonna be chatty. Great.
I'm Yasmin.
Are you a prisoner too?
No, I'm on vacation.
Okay, food's here.
Hope you like peanut butter. I used to.
translation.fr: T'aimes le beurre de cacahuète ? Moi oui, avant.

translation.en: Anything in these cabinets is off- limits.
Don't ever think Natacha won't miss this piece of popcorn.
translation.fr: Natacha saura si tu prends du pop-corn.

translation.en: - Lenore tells her everything. -
Come out, you evil skin- bag.
And that's the invisible cat? You say cat. I say Natacha's little spy- beast.
translation.fr: - C'est le chat invisible ? - C'est l'espionne de Natacha.

translation.en: And Natacha is…
Keep up. Natacha is the witch.
translation.fr: Suis un peu. C'est la sorcière.

translation.en: Lenore is that wrinkled, hairless thing that follows you around all day, popping up out of nowhere.
translation.fr: Léonore est le truc ridé qui surgit de nulle part.

translation.en: She ratted me out over a stinking cup of noodles. I hate that cat.
translation.fr: Elle m'a balancée pour des nouilles. Je hais ce chat.

translation.en: Don't just stand there. Help me clean this up before Natacha gets home.
translation.fr: Aide-moi à nettoyer avant que Natacha rentre.

translation.en: Where is she, Natacha?
I don't know where she goes or what she does, but she can go anywhere she wants.
Talk about the ultimate passport, this apartment is it.
Come on. We both have work to do. I'll get you set up.
translation.fr: On a du boulot. Je vais t'aider.

translation.en: Ultimate passport?
The apartment travels all over the world, luring kids in.
translation.fr: Il voyage et attire les enfants.

translation.en: I'm from New York. Brooklyn.
I live in Washington. Washington, DC.
Or I did before.
I wonder if we're still in Brooklyn.
The apartment moves? When it needs fresh meat.
translation.fr: - L'appart bouge ? - Quand il faut du sang frais.

translation.en: Not literally. Jeez.
Thought you wrote scary stories.
Not anymore.
Ta- da.
This is so cool.
How is…
I mean, wow!
It can't be.
Hello!
How is this even possible?
The apartment can do two things.
It lures suckers like us in,
translation.fr: Il attire les idiots comme nous,

translation.en: and it has room to hold…
This is so cool.
…well, anything.
The Empty Classroom and Other Creepy Stories.
Nightdreams and Daymares.
Whispered Tales.
She does like stories.
I thought you said you weren't into that kinda stuff anymore.
translation.fr: Je croyais que tu n'aimais plus ça.

translation.en: - I'm not. It's my friend. - Oh, it's your friend?
translation.fr: - Pas moi. Mon ami. - Ton ami ?

translation.en: He, uh… he'd like all this stuff.
But me? Nah.
- He's, like… he's really lame. - Yeah, he sounds lame.
translation.fr: - Il est trop nul. - Il a l'air.

translation.en: Hmm. Cool. Okay, yeah. So she makes me read her a stupid scary story every night,
translation.fr: Bref, je dois lui lire une histoire effrayante chaque soir,

translation.en: but she says everything in here's already been read.
translation.fr: mais elle a déjà tout lu.

translation.en: Everything?
Good thing you're a storyteller.
She needs you, so get to work.
translation.fr: Elle a besoin de toi, allez.

translation.en: You heard her. She wants a scary story tonight.
translation.fr: Elle veut une histoire ce soir.

translation.en: Every day, write as many stories as you can.
I don't write-- Cut the crap.
I heard you last night, talking about your Nightbook thingies.
translation.fr: Je t'ai entendu parler de tes journaux.

translation.en: Oh, those.
I'm over the whole writing thing.
Then you better get over getting over it and crank out some new tales, 'cause if you don't--
translation.fr: T'as intérêt à t'y remettre parce que sinon…

translation.en: She'll kill me. I know.
You'll be lucky if she kills you.
translation.fr: T'auras de la chance si elle te tue.

translation.en: This is your life now.
Forget your family. Forget your friends. Focus on being useful to Natacha.
translation.fr: Oublie ta famille, tes amis. Sois utile à Natacha.

translation.en: You wanna live?
Write scary stories.
I'm not gonna write anything,
'cause I'm getting out of here.
You're gonna die.
Come on, open.
Where are you?
Another exit.
Damn.
Every time.
You all try and run.
There's no escape.
You understand?
You understand?
Hmm. Were you purposely making me wait?
- No. I… I was doing the dishes. - Sit there.
- Should I just start reading? -
Give me a minute to get settled.
I mean, honestly!
What is that?
Do you know what happens to children who ask too many questions?
translation.fr: Tu sais ce qui arrive quand on pose trop de questions ?

translation.en: Do you wanna find out?
So, Storyteller,
you tried to escape today.
Yasmin, too, had a little rebellious streak.
translation.fr: Yasmin aussi a eu une période rebelle.

translation.en: But I am curious about one thing.
Why burn your stories?
What is that?
Read. Now.
When… when Todd's best friend Jenny died, his heart shattered into a thousand pieces.
translation.fr: Quand Jenny, l'amie de Todd mourut, son cœur se brisa.

translation.en: Shattered heart? I like it already.
translation.fr: Un cœur brisé ? Ça me plaît.

translation.en: Everyone avoided the Foster Playground at night. They all knew the legend.
translation.fr: Nul ne venait au terrain de jeu à cause de la légende.

translation.en: In the hour before daylight, the dead kids would come out and play.
Nope. No, no, no. Sorry, nope.
Everyone knows that ghosts haunt places that are personal to them, not public places.
translation.fr: Les fantômes hantent des lieux personnels, pas publics.

translation.en: Uh, are… are you sure?
I'm sure.
Get on with it.
Todd walks to the playground. He gets to the gate.
translation.fr: Todd se rend au terrain de jeux,

translation.en: And as soon as his foot crosses the threshold,
translation.fr: et dès qu'il y met les pieds,

translation.en: children…
- - …squealing, playing.
Suddenly, a boy shoots out of the slide.
translation.fr: Soudain, un garçon sort du toboggan.

translation.en: Maybe he's ten or so, dressed like a newsie from the '20s.
translation.fr: Environ dix ans, un gavroche des années 20.

translation.en: Rude. You could at least say hi.
I… I mean… I mean hi.
I'm looking for my friend, Jenny.  …Todd says, while looking for any sign of her.
translation.fr: Je cherche mon amie, Jenny. Dit Todd.

translation.en: To find her, you have to play.
translation.fr: Pour la trouver, tu dois jouer.

translation.en: The newsie whistles, and half a dozen dead kids surround Todd.
translation.fr: Le gavroche siffle et les morts encerclent Todd.

translation.en: Their skin is deathly white. Some of their clothes date back decades.
translation.fr: Leur peau est blafarde. Leurs vêtements démodés.

translation.en: They push Todd on a swing, higher and higher--
translation.fr: Ils poussent Todd sur une balançoire.

translation.en: Stupid!
Everyone knows ghosts don't have actual physical hands,
translation.fr: Les fantômes n'ont pas de mains physiques,

translation.en: so they could never push him on a swing.
translation.fr: donc ils ne peuvent pas le pousser.

translation.en: The playground is… it's an interdimensional plane, a mix between the spirit world and the real world.
translation.fr: C'est un lieu interdimensionnel entre le monde des esprits et le réel.

translation.en: Oh, so you're a quantum physicist now?
- Whatever. Continue. -
And then the children laugh, and they pull Todd to a rusty merry- go- round.
translation.fr: Les enfants rient et guident Todd vers un manège rouillé.

translation.en: They spin him around and around, faster and faster,
translation.fr: Ils le font tourner de plus en plus vite

translation.en: making Todd dizzier and dizzier.
Then the ghosts force Todd onto a seesaw.
He holds on tight.
Suddenly, Todd realizes what they're up to.
Any living child still on the playground when the sun rises is cursed to remain there forever.
translation.fr: Un enfant vivant, sur le terrain de jeux à l'aube, y restera pour toujours.

translation.en: He stumbles towards the gate, desperate to get out,
but his world is spinning, and he's tripping over his own feet.
translation.fr: mais il a le tournis et trébuche.

translation.en: The sun's almost up. He's nearly out of time. All the ghost children watch in suspense.
translation.fr: Le soleil se lève. Les fantômes observent en suspens.

translation.en: Todd's not going to make it. Until suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him towards the exit.
translation.fr: Todd n'y arrivera pas. Mais quelqu'un l'attrape et l'expulse.

translation.en: It's Jenny!
'Jenny, I… I wanted to see you.'
'Get out of here,' Jenny says, not stopping for a happy reunion.
Seeing his old friend again makes Todd's heart hurt.
I miss you. I don't wanna let you go.
translation.fr: Tu me manques, ne pars pas.

translation.en: But in death, Jenny discovered something that Todd is about to learn.
translation.fr: Mais dans la mort, Jenny a appris une chose.

translation.en: Friends never let go, Todd.
Because friends never forget.
I'll always be with you,
here.
A happy ending?
- - Are you out of your mind?
No happy endings, you fool.
Jenny… Jenny's dead. She's… she's trapped on the playground forever.
translation.fr: Jenny est morte, piégée sur le terrain.

translation.en: - It's not happy for her. -
Ghostly hands go on Todd's back.
translation.fr: Des fantômes touchent le dos de Todd.

translation.en: He… he… he glances behind him, and he's pulled into the playground.
translation.fr: Il se retourne et est entraîné sur le terrain.

translation.en: He… he screams for help, but it's no use.
translation.fr: Il appelle à l'aide, en vain.

translation.en: His ghostly soul is trapped there to this very day.
translation.fr: Son âme fantomatique y est piégée.

translation.en: Happy endings are a dangerous thing.
Never forget that.
Did you at least like the story? I mean, until the ending?
translation.fr: L'histoire vous a plu ? À part la fin ?

translation.en: Writers, always so insecure.
translation.fr: Les écrivains sont bourrés de doute.

translation.en: You're still alive, aren't you?
I'm mystified by you, Storyteller.
This beautiful darkness dances inside your brain.
translation.fr: Une si belle obscurité danse dans ton cerveau.

translation.en: You should celebrate it.
But you run from it. Why?
I just…
I… I wanna be like everyone else.
You wrote all this today?
Uh, I had… I had trouble writing today.
translation.fr: J'ai eu du mal à écrire.

translation.en: What?
It's just hard to concentrate with someone staring at me all day.
translation.fr: C'est dur de se concentrer quand on te fixe.

translation.en: I told you, show him the library and then get out.
translation.fr: Tu devais lui montrer la bibliothèque et sortir.

translation.en: Wait! Wait!
Not her! Not her.
You were disturbing him.
- - It is very important that he writes.
You know how important it is.
Wait!
It… it wasn't her fault either.
Well, if it wasn't Yasmin's fault, and it wasn't Lenore's fault,
translation.fr: Si ce n'était pas Yasmin ni Léonore,

translation.en: then whose fault was it?
Mine. I'll… I'll write faster.
Lenore won't bother you again.
No more excuses, Storyteller.
Are you okay?
Leave me alone.
Yasmin, I'm sorry. I wasn't trying to get you in any kind of trouble.
translation.fr: Je suis désolé. Je voulais pas te causer d'ennuis.

translation.en: Yasmin, I'm sorry. I didn't know about the no happy endings thing.
translation.fr: Je suis désolé. J'ignorais pour les fins heureuses.

translation.en: Todd shouldn't have gone back for Jenny.
- He was stupid. - No, he wasn't.
He was her friend, and that's what friends do.
translation.fr: C'est ce que font les amis.

translation.en: Maybe in fairy tales. But in here? She's right, you know.
translation.fr: Dans les contes de fées. Mais ici ? Elle a raison.

translation.en: Happy endings don't exist.
What?
What… what is that?
This place sucks.
She wants stories? Fine. I'll give her some stories.
translation.fr: Elle veut des histoires ? Elle en aura.

translation.en: Yes! Yes, a haunted desk! Haunted by the spirit of somebody who died working at it.
translation.fr: Oui, un bureau hanté ! Par l'esprit de celui mort en y travaillant.

translation.en: No, no, it's stupid. They're gonna think it's stupid.
How long you been here for? Looks like a while.
translation.fr: Tu es là depuis quand ? Longtemps, on dirait.

translation.en: How'd they get you? They got me with a piece of pie and Lost Boys.
translation.fr: Elle m'a eu avec de la tarte et Génération perdue.

translation.en: Once upon a time,
Alex stared up at the ceiling.
Then the ceiling fell on him
translation.fr: Puis le plafond lui tomba dessus

translation.en: and put him out of his misery.
The end.
What's up there?
It's the oldest book in here.
This thing's gotta be, like, a thousand years old.
translation.fr: Ce truc doit avoir mille ans.

translation.en: Kinder und Hausmärchen.
Sleeping Beauty?
Hansel and Gretel.
Is that a ballpoint pen?
Wow. Frankenstein.
Oh my God.
It's writing.
If I don't make it out of here, I need someone to know what happened,
translation.fr: Si je meurs, quelqu'un doit savoir ce qui est arrivé,

translation.en: even if it's only the characters in these books.
translation.fr: même si ça reste dans ces livres.

translation.en: I saw a unicorn.
People said they didn't exist, but there it was.
I followed it into this apartment, and now I'm trapped by a witch.
translation.fr: Je l'ai suivie et me voilà piégée par une sorcière.

translation.en: She's mean and scary.
I just have to do what the witch tells me to until Mom and Dad find me.
translation.fr: Je dois lui obéir jusqu'à ce que mes parents me trouvent.

translation.en: There are other kids here. Most of them are nice.
translation.fr: Il y a d'autres enfants ici.

translation.en: I'm scared, but at least I'm not alone.
translation.fr: J'ai peur, mais je ne suis pas seule.

translation.en: Dinner in an hour.
do you like unicorns?
Yeah, 'cause that's so me.
Oh, I thought maybe that's how she got you.
translation.fr: Elle t'a pas piégée comme ça ?

translation.en: Natacha, I mean.
You're right. It's none of my business.
And I bet you weren't lured in by a stupid movie and a piece of pie.
translation.fr: Elle t'a pas eue avec un film débile et de la tarte.

translation.en: Stupid pumpkin pie.
Fine.
It was doro wat.
What the hell is doro wat?
Chicken, onions caramelized in spiced butter, paprika, garlic,
translation.fr: Poulet, oignons caramélisés, paprika, ail, gingembre, épices berbères.

translation.en: ginger, berbere spice.
My āyatē…
My grandmother and I used to make it before she died.
translation.fr: Ma grand-mère et moi en faisions.

translation.en: We even grew all the herbs and veggies ourselves.
Anyways, I smelled doro wat,
translation.fr: Bref, j'ai senti le doro wat,

translation.en: and I just so badly wanted to see my āyatē again.
translation.fr: et je voulais tellement revoir mon āyatē.

translation.en: But it wasn't her.
It was a witch, an evil, wicked witch.
translation.fr: C'était une sorcière. Une méchante sorcière.

translation.en: How's that for a happy ending?
With the fangs came the hunger,
translation.fr: Avec les crocs vint la faim,

translation.en: and Katie discovered that her hunch was right. To a vampire, blood does taste like candy.
translation.fr: et Katie réalisa que pour un vampire, le sang a un goût de bonbon.

translation.en: Everybody knows it takes two days to grow full fangs.
translation.fr: Il faut deux jours pour que les crocs poussent.

translation.en: You're stupid.
Here, Lenore, a peace offering.
Story.
There's gotta be more writing from that Unicorn Girl.
translation.fr: Il doit y avoir d'autres notes.

translation.en: …but it's too late. The roller coaster plunges down the drop.
translation.fr: … trop tard. Les montagnes russes plongent.

translation.en: Steel snaps, metal shrieks,
translation.fr: … trop tard. Les montagnes russes plongent. Des hurlements métalliques,

translation.en: humans scream,
and the grim reaper's dog laughs at the carnage.
translation.fr: Le chien de la Faucheuse se moque du carnage.

translation.en: The grim reaper doesn't have a pet.
Isn't that right, Lenore?
This is gonna take forever!
They saw their son's footprints in the snow, leading into the woods.
translation.fr: Ils virent les empreintes de leur fils.

translation.en: Then they saw a pair of smaller footprints, teddy- bear- sized.
translation.fr: Puis, des plus petites, comme celles d'ours en peluche

translation.en: And they never saw their precious son again.
translation.fr: et ils ne revirent jamais leur fils.

translation.en: Possessed teddy bears? Really?
Took me right out of the story.
Every good story hints at truth.
translation.fr: Chaque bonne histoire s'inspire de la vérité.

translation.en: The more truth, the more powerful the story.
translation.fr: Plus c'est vrai, plus c'est puissant.

translation.en: From now on, get your facts straight.
I don't know how long I've been here.
I still have the necklace Mom and Dad gave me.
translation.fr: J'ai encore le collier de mes parents.

translation.en: I used to touch it to remember them, but I stopped.
translation.fr: Je le touchais en souvenir, mais j'ai arrêté.

translation.en: It made me cry. I'm tired of crying.
translation.fr: Ça me faisait pleurer. J'en ai assez.

translation.en: I have what I need to escape tonight. I'm finally going to see them again, Mom and Dad.
translation.fr: J'ai ce qu'il faut pour fuir. Je vais revoir mes parents.

translation.en: I wonder if they'll even know me. Can people forget their kids?
- Escape? - Alex?
Oh my God!
You did not just throw a book at me!
Uh, no. You just surprised me. I dropped it.
translation.fr: Tu m'as surpris. Je l'ai fait tomber.

translation.en: Hold on. I'm coming down.
Hey, Yasmin, wait until you see what I found.
translation.fr: Attends de voir ce que j'ai trouvé.

translation.en: Hey, what's wrong?
This is Natacha's night nursery. Night nursery?
translation.fr: - C'est la pépinière de nuit. - Quoi ?

translation.en: Yeah. Sunlight is bad for magical plants. Come on.
translation.fr: Le soleil est nocif aux plantes magiques. Viens.

translation.en: What's all this for?
Ingredients mostly, for Natacha's potions.
Don't touch anything.
What's that?
Demon silk. Enough questions. Help me with this.
translation.fr: Crinière du diable. Tais-toi et aide-moi.

translation.en: I watered the vine with rat's blood instead of bat's blood.
translation.fr: J'ai arrosé avec le mauvais sang et des œufs de broyeur poussent.

translation.en: Now, Shredder eggs are growing on it. If one of them hatches,
translation.fr: J'ai arrosé avec le mauvais sang et des œufs de broyeur poussent. Si l'un d'eux éclot, adieu la pépinière, et Natacha me tuera.

translation.en: it can destroy the night nursery, and Natacha will kill me.
translation.fr: Si l'un d'eux éclot, adieu la pépinière, et Natacha me tuera.

translation.en: - I'm taking care of it, Lenore. -
Okay. Put it gently on the ground.
Be careful. Don't jostle it.
Be careful.
Okay, now what?
Stomp it as hard as you can.
translation.fr: Écrase-le aussi fort que tu peux.

translation.en: Good.
Where's the blue mist come from? Do you make it? The mist, do you think it keeps Natacha young?
translation.fr: C'est toi qui fais la brume bleue ? Ça garde Natacha jeune ?

translation.en: It's none of our business.
I mean, she's really pretty, but her books are ancient, and the apartment looks like a granny decorated it.
translation.fr: Elle est jolie, mais ses livres sont vieux et on dirait l'appart d'une mamie.

translation.en: I thought for sure it was gonna--
- - Did you get it?
It's getting away!
It's cutting down the Shredder eggs! Stomp on them!
Sorry.
That's all the Shredder eggs.
There it is! Don't let it get away!
Alex, look out!
Thanks, Yas.  I mean, Yasmin.
Wait. Where is it?
We need to find it and kill it before it destroys the whole place.
translation.fr: On doit le tuer avant qu'il casse tout.

translation.en: Well, that's just great!
Get it off me!
I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay.
It's gone.
I don't know where it went.
Let's go!
- Come on! - Wait.
Gotcha.
Now let's get out of here.
You useless little twits.
You've been misbehaving in my garden.
translation.fr: Vous avez fait des vôtres dans mon jardin.

translation.en: This will hurt you far more than it hurts me.
translation.fr: Ça va vous créer des ennuis plus qu'à moi.

translation.en: Please, I… I can explain.
And I would let you if I cared.
translation.fr: Et je t'écouterais si ça m'intéressait.

translation.en: Do try to keep your eyes open.
I would hate to have to start over.
Can't you do anything right? I said keep your eyes open!
translation.fr: Tu n'écoutes rien. Je t'ai dit de garder les yeux ouverts !

translation.en: It was my fault!
I begged Yasmin to take me to the nursery. I thought the creepy plants might help me think of something cool to write about.
translation.fr: Je l'ai suppliée de m'y emmener. J'espérais que ça m'inspirerait.

translation.en: She made me promise not to touch anything, but I did.
translation.fr: Elle m'a dit de rien toucher, mais…

translation.en: Don't hurt her. Please.
That is very brave of you, Storyteller,
to lie right to my face.
I almost killed you.
If I didn't need you to clean up the mess, I would've.
translation.fr: Mais j'ai besoin que tu nettoies.

translation.en: No more chances.
Yas, you okay?
Look,
I'm sorry I got you involved.
From now on, you help yourself. I'll help myself.
translation.fr: À partir de maintenant, on s'ignore.

translation.en: Yas, we can get out of here, together.
translation.fr: Yas, on peut sortir d'ici, ensemble.

translation.en: It's not Yas.
It's Yasmin.
- - Shredder!
Gotcha!
- - Here we go. Okay.
One…
…two,
three!
Get… get off me! Get off me! Get off!
Ugh! My Nightbooks.
- Watch out. -
Lenore's here somewhere.
- She's hurting. - You look terrible.
translation.fr: - Elle souffre. - T'as une sale tête.

translation.en: - You've been here all night? - Yeah, all night.
translation.fr: - Tu as passé la nuit ici ? - Oui.

translation.en: I made this. It'll help with the scrapes and cuts.
You made this for me?
Yeah, it's my own concoction.
It's a kind of aloe from a harpy plant, some dried corpse- hair vine.
translation.fr: Plante harpie, vigne de poils de cadavre.

translation.en: That's good. Really good.
Thanks.
Uh, Lenore?
- Come here. -
Look what Yas made for us.
Didn't make it for her.
There you go, all better.
It's okay. Here we go.
I'm in trouble.
I… I… I don't have any stories.
What do you mean you don't have any? You said you had a bunch of them.
translation.fr: Comment ça ? Tu en avais un tas.

translation.en: I did, but a Shredder, it got into my room.
translation.fr: Un broyeur est entré dans ma chambre.

translation.en: And I killed it, but it destroyed all of my Nightbooks,
translation.fr: Je l'ai tué, mais il a détruit mes journaux,

translation.en: except for this one.
I was reading to Natacha from those Nightbooks.
translation.fr: Je lisais ces journaux à Natacha.

translation.en: I've got nothing now. I… I have to escape. I have no choice!
translation.fr: Je n'ai plus rien. Je dois fuir. J'ai pas le choix.

translation.en: There are two ways out. The front door where you came in and the back door--
translation.fr: Il y a deux portes. L'entrée et celle du fond.

translation.en: The back door! It goes outside. I saw Natacha go through there. There's--
translation.fr: Celle du fond mène vers l'extérieur. J'y ai vu Natacha.

translation.en: But Natacha's the only one that has the keys to that door.
translation.fr: Mais elle seule a les clés.

translation.en: You need to get over this escape nonsense and write something.
translation.fr: Oublie ça et écris quelque chose.

translation.en: - I've been trying! - Try harder!
I can't write!
- - Look, Natacha will find out tonight.
translation.fr: Natacha saura que je suis inutile et elle me tuera.

translation.en: - I'll be useless to her. She'll kill me. - She won't just kill you.
translation.fr: Natacha saura que je suis inutile et elle me tuera. Elle te tuera pas.

translation.en: There were four of us.
Eli, Little Hwan, Claire,
and me.
Hwan was too young, but the rest of us took turns reading to Natacha.
translation.fr: Hwan était trop jeune, mais on lisait à Natacha.

translation.en: Afterwards, we'd all huddle together at night
translation.fr: Après, on se réunissait la nuit

translation.en: and dream about escaping.
You're saying these are…
Last night, I almost joined them.
One day, the kitchen sink got clogged.
Natacha's magic couldn't fix it.
translation.fr: Natacha n'a pas pu le réparer.

translation.en: That's because I blocked the pipe myself with starstell moss.
translation.fr: Je l'avais bouché avec de la mousse d'étoile molle.

translation.en: The moss resists magic.
I wanted to force Natacha to call the plumber.
translation.fr: Je voulais que Natacha appelle le plombier.

translation.en: I taped a note under the sink for him to find, begging him to get help.
translation.fr: J'ai mis un mot sous l'évier pour lui, demandant de l'aide.

translation.en: But…
he never came.
Natacha found the note, didn't she?
Claire spent her last moments convincing Natacha that she did it…
translation.fr: Claire a convaincu Natacha qu'elle l'avait écrit…

translation.en: not me.
Claire lied to save me.
translation.fr: Claire a menti pour me sauver.

translation.en: Like… you did.
'Cause that's what friends do.
translation.fr: C'est ce que font les amis.

translation.en: I used to love writing scary stories,
but then I decided to stop.
And now that I have to write…
translation.fr: Et maintenant que je dois écrire…

translation.en: the… the ideas won't come to me anymore.
translation.fr: les idées ne me viennent pas.

translation.en: Did Hwan wear a watch?
Yeah. A big, blue plastic one. Why?
- And Claire, those earrings? - They were her aunt's.
translation.fr: - Claire, ces boucles d'oreilles ? - De sa tante.

translation.en: Why?
There's a way out of this place.
translation.fr: Il y a un moyen de fuir.

translation.en: - I have what I need to escape tonight. - Escape, Yasmin.
translation.fr: - J'ai ce qu'il faut pour fuir. - Fuir.

translation.en: I'm finally gonna see them again, Mom and Dad.
I wonder if they'll remember me. Can people forget their kids?
Unicorn Girl never took this off, and none of the kids in the cabinet are wearing it.
translation.fr: La fille à la licorne a jamais ôté ça et les enfants l'ont pas.

translation.en: You're right. And if she's not in the cabinet, then--
translation.fr: Si elle est pas dans l'armoire, alors…

translation.en: She did it. She escaped.
translation.fr: Elle a réussi. Elle s'est enfuie. J'ai ses notes.

translation.en: I've been piecing together her notes. There are bits here and there.
translation.fr: Elle a réussi. Elle s'est enfuie. J'ai ses notes. Elles sont cachées dans les livres.

translation.en: She hid them throughout the books, so in case Natacha found out--
translation.fr: Elles sont cachées dans les livres. - Si Natacha se doutait… - Elle ignorerait son plan.

translation.en: She wouldn't know her full plan.
translation.fr: - Si Natacha se doutait… - Elle ignorerait son plan.

translation.en: Okay, what's your plan?
Your plan sucks. We're not gonna find this today. You need to write a story for tonight.
translation.fr: C'est nul. On sera pas prêts. Écris une histoire pour ce soir.

translation.en: - Like right now. -
What do we do? It'd take, like, a thousand years to search all these books.
translation.fr: On fait quoi ? Il faudrait mille ans pour fouiller ces livres.

translation.en: A thousand years.
The thousand- year- old book.
The pen marks in the old book!
Come on. Please be here.
Is this the original Hansel and Gretel?  Grimm's Fairy Tales.
translation.fr: C'est le Hansel et Gretel d'origine ? Les Contes de Grimm.

translation.en: That's totally unrealistic. No one would just eat candy off of a strange house.
translation.fr: C'est irréaliste. Personne mangerait les bonbons d'une maison.

translation.en: I was right! More writing!  It's a recipe for a sleeping potion.
translation.fr: - Des notes ! - Une recette pour dormir.

translation.en: It smells awful. I need to figure out how to hide the stink so she'll drink it.
translation.fr: Ça pue. Je dois masquer l'odeur pour qu'elle le boive.

translation.en: I'm so close. I'll put her to sleep and steal her keys.
translation.fr: Je vais l'endormir et voler ses clés.

translation.en: I wish I had magic. I'd turn her into a toad or a snail and laugh at her all day long.
translation.fr: Avec de la magie, je la changerais en crapaud pour me moquer,

translation.en: Then I would turn her into a centipede and rip off her legs. All hundred legs, one at a time.
translation.fr: puis en mille-pattes, que je lui arracherais une par une.

translation.en: I'll keep looking. You have to write a story.
translation.fr: Je cherche. Tu écris une histoire.

translation.en: I don't think I can.
You're the only one who can. You've gotta buy us more time.
translation.fr: Toi seul le peux. Gagnons du temps.

translation.en: You don't think I'm weird?
That I…
I like to write scary stories?
Weird?
Who called you that?
Well, they're right. You are weird.
I mean, look at you.
But the thing that makes you weird makes them ordinary.
translation.fr: Mais ce qui te rend bizarre les rend ordinaires.

translation.en: And no one likes to be ordinary. Ordinary sucks.
So ordinary people are gonna try and take that away from you…
translation.fr: Les gens ordinaires essayeront de t'enlever ça…

translation.en: by calling you names like
- Tryhard or-- - Creepshow.
Yeah, or Creepshow.
Thanks, Yasmin.
It's Yas.
Do you have those ingredients?
Yeah. Yeah, I do.
But she's right. Suckleweed stinks.
translation.fr: Mais elle a raison, ça pue.

translation.en: How did she mask the smell? She must've found another ingredient.
translation.fr: - Comment a-t-elle masqué l'odeur ? - Avec un autre ingrédient.

translation.en: The only other person who would know is Natacha, but she would never tell us.
translation.fr: La seule qui saurait, c'est Natacha, mais elle dira rien.

translation.en: I do have an idea.
I could write a story to trick her into giving us the final ingredient of the sleeping potion.
translation.fr: Je vais la pousser à nous donner le dernier ingrédient.

translation.en: You know what happens if she figures out what we're up to?
translation.fr: Tu sais ce qui arrivera si elle comprend ?

translation.en: I know what happens if we don't try.  What's the name of the story?
translation.fr: - Si on n'essaie pas aussi. - Alors, son nom ?

translation.en: Not that one.
You're happy with that one.
I don't like you happy.
I want a story that'll make you squirm.
translation.fr: Je veux une histoire qui te perturbe.

translation.en: Here's the story I want.
Why burn your Nightbooks?
You thought I forgot about that, didn't you?
I was…
I was… I just… I was…
Uh… Oh my God.
I'm so sorry. I'm so stupid.
Yes, you are. I've only been saying that for years. Now you get it.
translation.fr: Je le dis depuis des années. Tu comprends enfin.

translation.en: Where was I?
You were about to tell me to start reading.
Oh yes. Well then, what are you waiting for?
Get on with it.
For generations, the evil sorcerer of Quantel
sent children to mine jewels from the mouth of the great monster.
translation.fr: envoya des enfants à la mine du grand monstre.

translation.en: A thousand years ago, the evil sorcerer had a chance to kill the odious beast,
translation.fr: Il y a mille ans, il aurait pu tuer la bête odieuse,

translation.en: but instead he used a powerful potion to keep the monster unconscious,
translation.fr: mais il utilisa une potion pour la garder inconsciente,

translation.en: to make himself rich.
Odious. Good word.
Every morning, the sorcerer funneled his potion
translation.fr: Le matin, il versait sa potion

translation.en: down the monster's fifth ear, and the beast remained unconscious.
translation.fr: dans l'oreille du monstre, gardant la bête inconsciente.

translation.en: The recipe was as old as time. Dissolved rat's bones, dry- aged widow orchid,
translation.fr: La recette était très ancienne. Os de rat dissous, orchidée vieillie,

translation.en: powdered beetle shells.
But the most important ingredient, however, was bindweed.
translation.fr: Mais l'ingrédient le plus important était le liseron.

translation.en: Bindweed was the only thing that could hide the powerful stench of the potion.
translation.fr: Lui seul pouvait masquer l'odeur de la potion.

translation.en: Without it, the rancid smell would rouse the great monster.
translation.fr: Sans lui, l'odeur éveillerait le monstre.

translation.en: But one day, the sorcerer went to harvest more bindweed,
translation.fr: Mais un jour, le sorcier alla en récolter

translation.en: and he discovered that the entire field had withered and died.
translation.fr: et il découvrit que le champ était mort.

translation.en: The potion smelled worse than ever.
Putrid, rank, malodorous--
Oh, yes, yes, yes. Understood. It stinks.
The sorcerer would have to kill the great monster once and for all.
translation.fr: Le sorcier devrait tuer le monstre une bonne fois pour toutes.

translation.en: He reluctantly raised his mighty staff to kill the beast,
translation.fr: Il éleva son bâton puissant pour tuer la bête,

translation.en: but a peasant girl came to him and promised a solution to his problem.
translation.fr: mais une paysanne s'approcha avec une solution.

translation.en: I know a replacement for bindweed. Your jewel harvest can continue.
translation.fr: Je sais par quoi remplacer le liseron.

translation.en: Foolish child. You know nothing of real magic.
translation.fr: Idiote, tu ne connais pas la magie.

translation.en: I can prove it. And if I do, I want a bag of jewels.
translation.fr: Je vous le prouverai en échange de bijoux.

translation.en: If it works, you will get two bags. If not, you will give me your life.
translation.fr: Si ça marche, tu en auras deux sacs. Sinon, tu me donneras ta vie.

translation.en: The peasant girl stepped forward and poured a mysterious dark liquid into the jug.
translation.fr: La paysanne s'avança et versa un liquide dans la cruche.

translation.en: The evil sorcerer sniffed the potion.
The smell disappeared. The sorcerer couldn't believe it.
translation.fr: Plus d'odeur ! Il n'y croyait pas.

translation.en: It smelled like daisies, roses, lilacs on a spring morning--
translation.fr: Ça sentait les pâquerettes, les roses, le lilas…

translation.en: The evil sorcerer poured the potion into the monster's ear and waited.
translation.fr: Il versa la potion dans l'oreille du monstre et attendit.

translation.en: The beast let out a long…  …grumble
translation.fr: La bête poussa un long grognement,

translation.en: then went still again.
Yes! But the peasant girl had removed more than just the smell from the potion.
translation.fr: Mais la paysanne avait retiré plus que l'odeur.

translation.en: She'd also erased all of its magic.
translation.fr: Elle avait ôté toute la magie.

translation.en: The sorcerer's potion was rendered useless.
translation.fr: La potion du sorcier était inutile.

translation.en: The peasant girl nodded to something behind him.
The eyes of the great monster were open.
translation.fr: Les yeux du monstre étaient ouverts.

translation.en: The sorcerer shrieked.
The peasant girl watched it all, smiling.
The evil sorcerer had sent her baby brother into that cave,
translation.fr: Le sorcier avait jeté son frère dans cette grotte

translation.en: and he never returned.
The peasant girl cared nothing about jewels. She got what she wanted, revenge.
translation.fr: La paysanne avait eu sa vengeance.

translation.en: And so she walked away
translation.fr: Elle s'éloigna alors que les dents du monstre

translation.en: as the monster's sharp teeth chomped down on the shrieking sorcerer,
translation.fr: Elle s'éloigna alors que les dents du monstre s'abattaient sur le sorcier,

translation.en: silencing him forever.
Just as the peasant girl thought she'd gotten away with it all, a black shadow loomed over her.
translation.fr: La paysanne pensait s'en être tirée, mais une ombre la suivait.

translation.en: It was the monster's giant foot, right above her.
translation.fr: Le pied du monstre, au-dessus d'elle.

translation.en: - Splat. -
The end.
And not a happy one.
Bindweed?
Yeah, me and Yasmin researched for hours.
translation.fr: Oui, on a fait des recherches.

translation.en: I know how important it is to get all the details right-- - No. - No?
translation.fr: - Les détails sont importants alors… - Non.

translation.en: I-- Of course I made up the potion's ingredients,
but I was sure that bindweed hides odors.
translation.fr: mais j'étais sûre que le liseron cachait les odeurs.

translation.en: - I really thought we got it right. - Well, there's your mistake. You worked with her.
translation.fr: - On s'est trompés ? - Voilà ton erreur. T'associer à elle.

translation.en: Bindweed keeps liquid from separating.
translation.fr: Le liseron empêche le liquide de se séparer.

translation.en: Everyone knows cinaroot hides smells,
translation.fr: On sait tous que la mandragore cache l'odeur,

translation.en: not bindweed.
Cinaroot, of course.
Is that cinaroot with an S or a C?
translation.fr: Il y a un R ou deux ?

translation.en: Let's do some science stuff.
Tonight, we're getting out of here.
Good night, Natacha.
Oh my God. What's happening?
It's turning green. I can't bring this out there.
translation.fr: C'est vert. Je peux pas lui apporter.

translation.en: Some kind of reaction?
Maybe the acidity of the lemonade-- The service here is terrible.
I don't have a story. We put two drops in the glass.
translation.fr: - J'ai rien écrit. - Mets deux gouttes dans le pichet.

translation.en: - Let's put two in the pitcher. - Will it put her to sleep?
translation.fr: - J'ai rien écrit. - Mets deux gouttes dans le pichet. Ça suffit ?

translation.en: Where is my lemonade?
It's coming!
What? I put it right here.
- Where is it? - What are you talking about?
Where is the potion? This has to happen.
She knows.
So, uh…
So it's…
It's…
Let's see.
So, um…
Any day now, Storyteller.
Yeah, yeah. It's, uh… it's here somewhere.
translation.fr: Oui. C'est quelque part par là.

translation.en: Spit it out.
- I just gotta find it. - Read!
Here it is.
So, um, this one is, um, called The Cuckoo Clock.
When Scott's parents bought the cuckoo clock at an estate sale,
translation.fr: Quand les parents de Scott achetèrent le coucou,

translation.en: he thought it was just another old- timey piece of junk.
translation.fr: il pensa que c'était encore une vieillerie.

translation.en: But there was something strange about the clock.
translation.fr: Mais il y avait quelque chose d'étrange.

translation.en: Every hour on the hour,
the little cuckoo would pop out,
and, uh, Steve started to notice--
Who's Steve?
I thought you said his name was Scott.
Sorry. Right. Uh, typo.
So… so Scott noticed that, uh, the cuckoo
seemed to look a little bit different every time it appeared.
translation.fr: avait l'air différent à chaque fois.

translation.en: Like, its eyes would--
- What is this? - Uh…
Where are all your stories, the ones that you're supposed to be writing every day?
translation.fr: Où sont tes histoires ? Celles que tu dois écrire chaque jour ?

translation.en: - I'm sorry. I'm sorry. - Where are your new stories?
The Shredder, it got into my backpack.
translation.fr: Le broyeur était dans mon sac.

translation.en: The Shredder ate your homework?
translation.fr: Le broyeur a mangé tes devoirs ?

translation.en: Uh, it's true. It escaped from the night nursery.
translation.fr: Il s'est échappé de la pépinière.

translation.en: - Quiet, girl. -
Thorns in my side…
- No! - …since the moment you arrived.
I'll make you the recipe. I-- Please. You can barely follow a recipe.
translation.fr: - Je vais faire la recette. - Tu peux à peine suivre une recette.

translation.en: He writes for you! You need him!  I'll write the best story for you!
translation.fr: - Vous avez besoin de lui ! - J'écrirai une super histoire !

translation.en: Hmm, let's face it.
This is long overdue.
Please, no! No!
What?
Don't touch her. Don't touch.
- Lenore. -
You okay?
What's… what's happening?
Oh no. What's wrong with you?
Something's wrong.
Poor little thing. What happened to you? Lenore put our potion in the bottle of mist.
translation.fr: - Qu'as-tu fait ? - Elle a mis la potion dans la brume.

translation.en: I can't believe it.
She must've gotten a dose of the sleeping potion.
translation.fr: Elle a dû en recevoir une dose.

translation.en: She's a prisoner, just like us.
- Thank you, Lenore. - Alex, we did it.
translation.fr: - Merci, Léonore. - Alex, on a réussi.

translation.en: - We beat her. -
How's that for following a recipe?
Wait. Where do you think it goes?
translation.fr: Tu crois que ça va où ?

translation.en: Home.
Never thought I'd see trees again.
Look.
I'm never gonna eat peanut butter ever again!  You can forget about pumpkin pie for me!
translation.fr: - Plus de beurre de cacahuète ! - Ni de tarte à la citrouille !

translation.en: First food when I get back? Vanilla milkshake!
translation.fr: Je vais prendre un milk-shake vanille !

translation.en: Whoa, whoa, wait, Alex. Hold up. Hold up. Just wait a second.
That's widow's grub. That's sunken lily. Why is that here?
translation.fr: De la bave de veuve, du lys enchanté. Pourquoi c'est là ?

translation.en: The door, it wasn't the way out.
translation.fr: La porte, ce n'était pas la sortie.

translation.en: We're still in the apartment.
Evil unicorn!
Run!
Run!
Alex, it's getting closer!
It's too fast!
Oh my God.
- What just happened? - Maybe something spooked it?
translation.fr: - Que s'est-il passé ? - Elle a eu peur ?

translation.en: Every good story hints at truth.
translation.fr: Chaque bonne histoire s'inspire de la vérité.

translation.en: Oh my God.
Hansel and Gretel was real.
- - We're in Hansel-- It smells so delicious.
translation.fr: - On est dans Hansel… - Ça sent si bon.

translation.en: So hungry.
We… we shouldn't be in here, Yas.
Hello?
Yas, what's wrong with you?
Hello?
I'm… I'm okay.
This is probably fine.
- Well, well, well! - Sleeping Beauty awakes.
translation.fr: Eh bien… La Belle au bois dormant se réveille.

translation.en: Oh, wait. Wrong story.
- Are you guys okay? - Yeah.
We're okay.
The mist, that's where it comes from.
You're harvesting it.
Who's inside that coffin?
The original witch,
who, by the way, does eat children.
We thought you were the original witch. We thought the blue mist kept you young.
translation.fr: On pensait que c'était vous. Que la brume vous gardait jeune.

translation.en: I don't need the mist to keep me young.
translation.fr: Je n'ai pas besoin de la brume pour ça.

translation.en: It gives me her magic. What?
translation.fr: - Ça me donne sa magie. - Quoi ?

translation.en: How? I was about your age when she got me.
translation.fr: - Comment ? - J'avais votre âge quand elle m'a piégée.

translation.en: There were lots of us back then.
But we weren't dumb.
We knew not to get attached,
because she got hungry.
She ate them?
Yes.
All of them.
And then I… I had to clean the oven.
translation.fr: Et j'ai dû nettoyer le four.

translation.en: I pretended to like her.
Pretended to want to be like her. I became her favorite.
translation.fr: vouloir être comme elle. Je suis devenue sa préférée.

translation.en: But when I was alone, I plotted my escape.
I would get her to trust me.
And then, a sleeping potion,
translation.fr: Et puis, une potion de sommeil,

translation.en: and I would be free.
I ran straight home…
but my parents were gone.
They left you.
I had nowhere else to go,
so I came back here.
Who cares about them?
You were just like us.
Wait.
The sleeping potion…
You're Unicorn Girl.
translation.fr: Vous êtes la fille à la licorne.

translation.en: You read my diaries.
Did you meet my pet?
The unicorn?
That's your pet? I made him.
translation.fr: - C'est votre animal ? - Je l'ai créée.

translation.en: I make many things now.
translation.fr: Je crée un tas de choses.

translation.en: She's the one who's been shaking the apartment?
If she doesn't get a story, we're all gonna die.
translation.fr: Si elle n'a pas d'histoire, on mourra.

translation.en: Stories keep her asleep.
Stories of fear and suffering and death are like sweet lullabies to her.
translation.fr: Les histoires de peur et de mort sont ses berceuses.

translation.en: - Tell one. -
I don't have a story.
Oh, yes, you do.
Tell us the reason that you wanted to destroy your Nightbooks.
translation.fr: Dis-nous pourquoi tu voulais détruire tes journaux.

translation.en: - - But…  …that's not scary--
It was, to you.
All that pain and fear and sadness
translation.fr: Toute la douleur, la peur et le chagrin

translation.en: that you've been avoiding this whole time.
translation.fr: que tu as évité tout ce temps.

translation.en: Tell it!
Now, Alex! You think I'm a bad witch?
translation.fr: Allez, Alex ! Tu me crois méchante ?

translation.en: Just wait until she wakes up and sees you.
So young, so plump, so juicy--
translation.fr: Si jeune, si dodu, si juteux…

translation.en: There once was a boy who… who loved to write scary stories.
translation.fr: Il était une fois un garçon qui aimait l'horreur.

translation.en: Every day, on his free time, he would come up with new ways to scare his classmates.
translation.fr: Chaque jour, il essayait d'effrayer ses camarades.

translation.en: But…  …they just didn't get his fascination with creepy things.
translation.fr: Mais ils ne partageaient pas sa lubie des choses flippantes.

translation.en: To them, he was just… weird.
What's wrong with you? they'd ask.
Many of them were cruel, calling him names, like Creepshow.
translation.fr: Beaucoup étaient cruels, l'appelaient M'sieur Bizarre.

translation.en: Except for Joshua.
Josh was his best friend
since kindergarten.
Alex finishes his latest bone- chilling tale,
translation.fr: Alex termine son récit et a hâte de le partager.

translation.en: and he's excited to share it.
translation.fr: Alex termine son récit et a hâte de le partager. FIN… OU PAS ?

translation.en: Hey, you're gonna love this one.
Josh?
Alex catches up with Josh after class.
Wait. My birthday's tonight. We turned the apartment into a haunted house.
translation.fr: C'est mon anniversaire. On a fait une maison hantée.

translation.en: It's amazing. I've got tons of new stories ready.
translation.fr: Et j'ai plein de nouvelles histoires.

translation.en: Josh talks low, not wanting the others to hear.
translation.fr: Josh parle bas pour que personne n'entende.

translation.en: Cody's having a gaming party. His dad's getting the truck and everything.
translation.fr: Cody fait une fête. Il y aura des jeux vidéo.

translation.en: But to… tonight's my party.
translation.fr: Mais ce soir, c'est ma fête,

translation.en: …says Alex, confused and hurt.
Alex's hope sinks. He's desperate.
He says…
You're my best friend.
Josh tries to be gentle.
Yeah, right.
Cody's my friend now too. And you're just not…
translation.fr: Cody est mon ami aussi. Et t'es pas…

translation.en: Come on.
The way you dress, the things you like.
translation.fr: Ta façon de t'habiller, ce que tu aimes.

translation.en: All you do is talk about your scary stories.
translation.fr: Tu parles que de trucs flippants.

translation.en: Everyone thinks it's weird.
That's when Cody butts in.
Yo, Josh, you comin'?
Come on, J- Man.
All right, all right. Alex, I'll see you later, okay?
translation.fr: Oui. À plus tard, Alex. D'accord ?

translation.en: The boy had written a new story about a haunted house.
translation.fr: Le garçon avait écrit une histoire sur une maison hantée.

translation.en: He, his mom, and his dad
translation.fr: Sa mère, son père et lui

translation.en: had turned his whole apartment into that house.
No one showed up…
not even Josh.
They made him hate the thing he loved most.
translation.fr: Ils l'ont fait détester ce qu'il aimait le plus.

translation.en: And they made him hate himself.
translation.fr: Et ils l'ont fait se haïr.

translation.en: The real truth is, he was embarrassed to be himself,
translation.fr: La vérité, c'est qu'il était gêné d'être lui-même,

translation.en: so he decided to burn his Nightbooks.
translation.fr: alors il a voulu brûler ses journaux.

translation.en: He swore he'd never write another story again.
translation.fr: Il a juré de ne plus écrire d'histoires.

translation.en: He could be
a new person.
Not weird.
Not a freak.
He could be normal,
like Josh and his friends.
Then he wouldn't be alone.
The boy lost all his friends,
translation.fr: Le garçon a perdu tous ses amis,

translation.en: so he decided to destroy that part of himself that created the Nightbooks.
translation.fr: alors il a voulu détruire ce côté en lui qui créait les journaux.

translation.en: Then a witch captured him. She said she liked his stories.
translation.fr: Puis une sorcière l'a capturé. Elle a dit qu'elle aimait ses histoires.

translation.en: The witch was lying.
But being captured by her was the best thing that ever happened to me…
translation.fr: Mais qu'elle m'ait piégé est ce qui m'est arrivé de mieux

translation.en: …because I made new friends,
translation.fr: car je me suis fait des amis.

translation.en: friends who love me for who I am, not for who they want me to be.
translation.fr: Qui m'aiment pour qui je suis vraiment.

translation.en: What have you done? No!
- No! - This is our happy ending! No happy endings.
- Guys, let's get out of here. - Fine.
Oh! No! No, you idiot! What have you done? You stupid children.
- - Oh God! Oh God!
Oh God.
You're awake.
Finally.
You've been asleep here so long, the… the candy is infecting you.
translation.fr: Tu dors depuis si longtemps que le bonbon t'infecte.

translation.en: You…
You did this to me.
I have lived in fear of you for so long, but I am not that little girl anymore.
translation.fr: Je vis dans la peur depuis longtemps, mais je ne suis plus une enfant.

translation.en: Witch fight! - Let's get out of here! - Let's go!
Go! Just go!
- - Go! Go!
Help! We need help! Get us out of here!
A witch is gonna eat us! Help!
translation.fr: Une sorcière va nous manger ! À l'aide !

translation.en: Can anyone hear me?
Alex, move. I've seen Natacha do this.
translation.fr: Alex, bouge. J'ai vu Natacha faire ça.

translation.en: You… you did it. You did it.
- I'm home. - Let's go.
- Lenore! - We gotta go.
We're still in my building. The apartment didn't move.
translation.fr: C'est mon immeuble. L'appart a pas bougé.

translation.en: - Do you have a plan? - Not exactly a plan, an idea.
translation.fr: - Tu as un plan ? - Plutôt une idée.

translation.en: Hello, children.
I'm so hungry.
This is the worst elevator ever!
What now?
We just need to make it to that boiler room.
translation.fr: On doit aller à la chaufferie.

translation.en: You gotta be kidding me.
No, let… let her go. It's me you want.
translation.fr: Non, c'est moi que vous voulez.

translation.en: - Incorrect. -
I want both of you.
translation.fr: Je vous veux tous les deux.

translation.en: No. I'm sorry.
Stories about fear and death are like lullabies to her.  No, no, no.
translation.fr: Les histoires de peur et de mort sont ses berceuses.

translation.en: She's read all of them.
Hey, ugly.
You like stories? I got stories.
translation.fr: Vous aimez les histoires ? J'en ai.

translation.en: Jason couldn't decide which was stranger.
translation.fr: Le plus étrange pour Jason ? Que sa sœur meure

translation.en: The fact that his sister died every Tuesday at 11:15
translation.fr: Le plus étrange pour Jason ? Que sa sœur meure les mardis à 11h15 ou qu'elle ressuscite 20 min après ?

translation.en: or that she always came back to life 20 minutes later.
translation.fr: les mardis à 11h15 ou qu'elle ressuscite 20 min après ?

translation.en: More. Give me more.
Zachary had always thought that clowns were the scariest part of the circus.
translation.fr: Pour Zachary, les clowns étaient les plus effrayants.

translation.en: He was wrong.
I found a package on my front porch
addressed to the woman standing right behind you.
translation.fr: adressé à la femme qui se tient derrière vous.

translation.en: Who? Who was it? Who was it?
- The stories! - Push her! Push her in!
Keep pushing!
Don't let her out!
Keep it shut! Keep pushing!
- Keep it shut! - Keep her in!
- - Oh my God.
So that's why they call you a tryhard? Shut up, Creepshow.
translation.fr: - D'où ton nom, l'Acharnée ? - Tais-toi, M'sieur Bizarre.

translation.en: All right, skin- bag. We didn't forget about you. Come here.
translation.fr: Oui, sale peau. On t'a pas oubliée. Viens là.

translation.en: Let's go home.
Maybe we should take the stairs.
♪ Blind boys don't lie… ♪
Mom? Dad?
You're home. Oh!
These are my friends, Lenore and Yasmin.
- Hi. - Yas, for short.
♪ Thou shall not die ♪ ♪ Unchain me, sister! ♪
translation.fr: ELLE RETROUVE SA FAMILLE APRÈS 3 ANS

translation.en: Oh God, you scared me.
- Hey, Creepshow. - Hey, Tryhard.
My parents drove me up to surprise you.
- What is that? Like, your third story? - Fourth, actually.
So you could definitely use this.
Oh my God, Yas.
Check out the flowers. My next science fair project.
The effect of ultraviolet black light on photosynthetic organisms.
Still don't believe in happy endings?  I'm starting to.
translation.fr: - Et les fins heureuses ? - Je m'y fais.
